summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Fifty-seventh Street, from Twentieth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-second Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and materials, together with all catch basins, manholes and flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, all in accordance with Resolution No. 2556 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
